etymology.description: 大(大) (dà, "big") usually indicates size or importance. 栅(柵) (zhà, "fence") and 栏(欄) (lán, "railing") together depict a physical structure related to protection or guiding passage.
etymology.interpretation: 大(大) (dà, "big") in this context emphasizes the importance of 栅栏(柵欄) (shí làn, "fence or railing"), referring to a significant street historically known for its bustling commercial activity, likened to a place enclosed or guided by these structures.
etymology.simplification: The simplification involves changing 柵 to 栅 and 欄 to 栏.

examples.chinese: 大栅栏有很多老字号的店铺(大柵欄有很多老字號的店舖)。
examples.pinyin: dà zhàn lán yǒu hěn duō lǎo zì hào de diàn pù.
examples.english: Dà zhàn lán has many time-honored brand shops.

examples.chinese: 大栅栏保留着老北京的韵味(大柵欄保留著老北京的韻味)，吸引着众多历史爱好者(吸引著眾多歷史愛好者)。
examples.pinyin: dà zhàn lán bǎoliú zhe lǎo běijīng de yùn wèi, xī yǐn zhe zhòng duō lì shǐ ài hào zhě.
examples.english: Dà zhàn lán preserves the charm of old Beijing, attracting many history enthusiasts.
